titlestmt.titleproper: ABL Stained Glass Window Records - General Materials, Inclusive: 1988, undated

did.head: Records Summary
did.unittitle: ABL Stained Glass Window Records - General Materials
did.abstract: The ABL Stained Glass Window Records - General Materials consists of correspondence, financial records, and literary productions.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: The Armstrong Browning Library is a research library devoted to the study of the lives and works of the Victorian poets Robert and Elizabeth Barrett Browning. It houses the world's largest collection of books, letters, manuscripts, and memorabilia pertaining to the Brownings, as well as a substantial collection of primary and secondary materials related to 19th-century literature and culture. Students and scholars are welcome to conduct research using its extensive non-circulating collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This paper collection represents general material concerning the Armstrong Browning Library's stained glass windows. It ranges from annotated notes, lists of the all the windows, and literary productions about stained glass. These documents are undated except for the "Research on Windows" that was created in 1988. An Armstrong Browning Library employee was tasked with gathering known information at the time about the windows in the building. The bulk of the collection consists of literary productions about stained glass windows which offer insight into the meaning of stained glass in general or of select windows in the Armstrong Browning Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This paper collection was originally in a few folders with no discernible order. Presently the material is grouped by subject then placed in alphabetical order.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: All requests for copying of materials must be submitted to the Armstrong Browning Library in writing. Please use the Request Form for Copying Materials sheet. Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator (s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

userestrict.head: Use/Re-use Restrictions
userestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: ABL Stained Glass Records - General Materials, Accession #ABL.7, Box #, Folder #, Armstrong Browning Library, Baylor University, Waco, Texas.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Described by Valencia Johnson. Released on 2021-04-20.
Archivist''s Notes: See also Armstrong Browning Library's Picture File for related material.

controlaccess.head: Subjects (Organizations)
controlaccess.corpname: Armstrong Browning Library — Records and correspondence.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: These are records collected over undefined years by the Armstrong Browning Library in regard to the stained glass windows in the building. It includes literary productions, records, and notes.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Archivist''s Notes: The contents in folder 6 state the documents are for the Treasure Hall. The official name for this room is Hankamer Treasure Room.
